messages.message:
:snake:  *Incoming Python 3.9 Upgrade*

Hey folks, wanted to raise awareness that we will be moving to Python 3.9 in the near future! Instructions for updating your local environment will come soon, but in the meantime I would like to take a quick poll. I*f you do local development*, please react with:

  :one: if you use pyenv to manage your Python environment
  :two: if you use venv to manage your Python environment
  :three: if you use conda to manage your Python environment
  :four: if you use another tool to manage your Python environment, or you’re not sure

If you’re not sure, try running `which python` to see where your `python` executable is coming from.

Please reach out if you have any concerns around the upgrade, or if you own any service/module that you think may warrant additional testing beyond unit/golden/system tests.
cc @lydia, I think doc insights has some code in other repos (ibformers?) that may also need to be updated. can you also share some info on how GPU training/MTT-GPU is tested?

We run GPU training in system tests and ibformers CI tests on various environments, which have a particular release of ibformers published.

cc @Rafal on how this upgrade might impact ibformers
